context.introduction: Learn the basics of Japanese rice and noodle preparation. Discover the importance of washing rice, noodle types, and cooking ratios.

sections.title: Rice Washing
sections.content: Japanese rice should be washed several times before cooking to remove excess starch and achieve the right texture.

sections.title: Noodle Varieties
sections.content: Ramen, soba, and udon are staple noodles in Japanese cuisine, each with unique characteristics.

sections.title: Soba: Buckwheat Noodles
sections.content: Soba noodles are made from buckwheat and are enjoyed hot or cold.

sections.title: Rice to Water Ratio
sections.content: The ideal ratio for Japanese rice is about 1:1.1 (rice:water) for perfect texture.

sections.title: Preparation Tips
listItems: Wash rice until water runs clear
Use the right noodle for each dish
Let rice rest after cooking for fluffiness
